analyzed: bya ; gang chos rnam par dag pa 'di dag ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: thinking, “These pure phenomena are the maṇḍala wheel of deities.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag nyid bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag nyid bstan par bya'o //
translated: These very thirty-seven factors of awakening should be taught.”

original: de la dag pa dang bde pa dang // rtag pa dang bdag rnams kyi phyin ci log bzhi rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa dran ba nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dag pa dang bde pa dang // rtag pa dang bdag rnams kyi phyin ci log bzhi rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa dran ba nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are the counteragents to the four errors of purity, pleasure, permanence and self.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag ba'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag ba'o //
translated: They are: the foundation of mindfulness of the body, the foundation of mindfulness of the sensations, the foundation of mindfulness of the mind and the foundation of mindfulness of entities.

original: dran pa ni nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la sems kyis ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la sems kyis ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the experienced object by the mind.

original: de'i nye bar 'jog ba ni dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar 'jog ba ni dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'o //
translated: The establishment of that is the foundation of mindfulness.

original: de yang brjed ngas pa'i gnyen por gyur pa ste //
analyzed: de yang brjed ngas pa'i gnyen por gyur pa ste //
translated: Moreover, it is the counteragent to forgetfulness.

original: sngon nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la nye bar 'jog ba ni 'dris pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: sngon nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la nye bar 'jog ba ni 'dris pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The establishment of the experienced object is the quality of familiarity.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i tshogs ni lus so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i tshogs ni lus so //
translated: The body is the collection of the primary and secondary elementary matter.

original: bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: The sensations are the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni chos so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni chos so //
translated: The ultimate is the entity.

original: so sor snang ba tsam gyis rnam par shes pa ni sems so //
analyzed: so sor snang ba tsam gyis rnam par shes pa ni sems so //
translated: Consciousness is the mere appearance of each object.

original: de rnams kyi rjes su dran pa ni nye bar gzhag pa ste lus la sogs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rjes su dran pa ni nye bar gzhag pa ste lus la sogs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are the mindfulness of the body, etc.🔽The four right efforts are the effort to abandon the seven things, such as laziness, etc., which are adverse to the virtues, such as faith, etc., which are the roots of virtue and the bases of success.🔽The seven things adverse to the roots of virtue are:

original: yang dag par 'byung ba mi dge ba'i rjes su mthun pa 'dod chags zhe sdang la sogs pa dge ba'i mi mthun par gyur pa le lo dang ma dad pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: yang dag par 'byung ba mi dge ba'i rjes su mthun pa 'dod chags zhe sdang la sogs pa dge ba'i mi mthun par gyur pa le lo dang ma dad pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: 1) lack of faith, 2) laziness, 3) forgetting the instruction, 4) slackness and excitedness, 5) lack of full attention, 6) distraction towards external things, 7) lack of restraint.

original: bdun pa la sogs pa 'di dag dmigs pas spong ba ni /
analyzed: bdun pa la sogs pa 'di dag dmigs pas spong ba ni /
translated: The seven things adverse to the bases of success are:🔽1) lack of desire to act, 2) lack of effort, 3) lack of will, 4) laziness, 5) lack of restraint, 6) distraction, 7) lack of full attention.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yin te /🔽'di lta ste /🔽mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams yang dag par bsrung ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yin te / 'di lta ste / mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams yang dag par bsrung ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'o //
translated: The four bases of success are:

original: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs bas 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs bas 'phel ba'o //
translated: 1) desire, 2) effort, 3) attention, 4) investigation.

original: de'i yan lag ni 'dun pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yan lag ni 'dun pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba'o //
translated: Its branches are the bases of psychic power consisting of will, effort, mind, and investigation.

original: de la spyod pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / brten pa med pa dang / kun du sbyor ba dang / yongs su gyur pa nyid shes pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyod pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / brten pa med pa dang / kun du sbyor ba dang / yongs su gyur pa nyid shes pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Among them, will is the knowledge of the analysis of the formative forces associated with practice, of freedom from attachment, of cessation, of non-reliance, of the fetters and of the transformation.

original: de la rnam par 'byed pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: de la rnam par 'byed pa ni lam mo //
translated: Among them, analysis is the path.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Freedom from attachment is nirvana, which is the relinquishment of the obscuration that consists in the afflictions.

original: 'gog pa @19b ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po kun du mi sbyor pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa @19b ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po kun du mi sbyor pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the non-association with all things that are subject to impurity.

original: de rnams mi brten pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa la brten pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams mi brten pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa la brten pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-reliance on those, i.e. on analysis, freedom from attachment and cessation, is the fetter.

original: kun du sbyor ba ni 'dus byas thams cad kyi dngos po la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba ni 'dus byas thams cad kyi dngos po la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Bondage is the connection of all conditioned things.

original: de yongs su gyur pa ni de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'o ;
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa ni de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'o ;
translated: Its transformation is the state of being in its own nature.

original: / lta bar byed pa'i shes pa 'di dag ni mig la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: / lta bar byed pa'i shes pa 'di dag ni mig la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po bstan par bya'o //
translated: These cognitions that see should be taught as the faculties of faith, etc., which are similar to the eye, etc.

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: They are of five kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: de la dad pa ni /
analyzed: de la dad pa ni /
translated: Here, faith is

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la yang dag pa'i lta pa dang las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa la sems yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la yang dag pa'i lta pa dang las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa la sems yid ches pa'o //
translated: the confidence of the mind in regard to the true view of the mundane and supramundane, and in regard to the enjoyment of the results of action.

original: sems kyi kun du sbyor ba ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: sems kyi kun du sbyor ba ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Perseverance is the bond of the mind.

original: dang ba'i dbang po la brten nas chos gang ma brjed pa ni brtson 'grus bstan to //
analyzed: dang ba'i dbang po la brten nas chos gang ma brjed pa ni brtson 'grus bstan to //
translated: The faculty of effort is taught as the non-forgetting of any phenomenon based on the faculty of faith.🔽The faculty of mindfulness is taught as the non-forgetting of any phenomenon based on the faculty of effort, the non-forgetting of the meaning.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ma brjed cing don ma brjed pa ni dran pa'i dbang bos chos rnams ma brjed pa gang mngon du byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang por bstan to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ma brjed cing don ma brjed pa ni dran pa'i dbang bos chos rnams ma brjed pa gang mngon du byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang por bstan to //
translated: The faculty of concentration is taught as the actualization of the non-forgetting of phenomena based on the faculty of mindfulness.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis rtse gcig par byas ba'i chos gang khyad par du gyur pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis rtse gcig par byas ba'i chos gang khyad par du gyur pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o ;
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the special quality of any phenomenon made one-pointed by concentration.

original: / ma dad pa dang le lo dang / brjed ngas pa dang / bag med pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa zang pa las khyad par thob pa'i dbang po nyid stobs su bstan te /
analyzed: / ma dad pa dang le lo dang / brjed ngas pa dang / bag med pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa zang pa las khyad par thob pa'i dbang po nyid stobs su bstan te /
translated: The powers are taught as the faculties that attain superiority over the discordant side, such as lack of faith, laziness, forgetfulness, carelessness, distraction, and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang ; shes rab kyi stobs so //
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang ; shes rab kyi stobs so //
translated: the power of faith, the power of effort, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom.

original: rang nyid kyis yang dag par khong du chud pa 'di ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis yang dag par khong du chud pa 'di ni byang chub ste /
translated: This is enlightenment, which is the realization of one’s own self.

original: sems gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sems gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the two kinds of self.

original: de'i rgyu ni byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The cause of that is the factors of enlightenment.

original: de rnams kyang bdun te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang bdun te /
translated: They are seven in number.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽The factor of perfect enlightenment that is perfect mindfulness,🔽the factor of perfect enlightenment that is perfect discernment of phenomena,🔽the factor of perfect enlightenment that is perfect effort,

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnams par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnams par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: the factor of perfect enlightenment that is perfect joy,🔽the factor of perfect enlightenment that is perfect pliancy,🔽the factor of perfect enlightenment that is perfect concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //🔽de la sems can @20a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //🔽de la sems can @20a * //
translated: and the factor of perfect enlightenment that is perfect equanimity.🔽Here, the factor of perfect enlightenment that is perfect mindfulness is

original: thams cad la phan par byed pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa dang / thos shing 'khor du chud pa ma brjed pa ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //🔽bdag la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad la phan par byed pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa dang / thos shing 'khor du chud pa ma brjed pa ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go // bdag la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: The limb of enlightenment that is mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the aspiration for enlightenment and the entry into the assembly of those who have heard the Dharma, because it benefits all.

original: phung po la sogs pa 'byed pa ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa 'byed pa ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The limb of enlightenment that is the investigation of phenomena is the differentiation of the aggregates, etc., because they are not in accord with the self, etc.

original: chos rnams ro gcig pa'i sems ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //🔽dga' ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bdag gi bag chags bcom pa las /
analyzed: chos rnams ro gcig pa'i sems ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go // dga' ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bdag gi bag chags bcom pa las /
translated: The limb of enlightenment that is joy is the mind that is of one taste with regard to phenomena.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems las su rung ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems las su rung ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The limb of enlightenment that is ease is the pliancy of body, speech, and mind, because it conquers the resistances to joy, i.e., the instincts for the notions of self and mine.

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang chos kyi dbyings te tshad ma bzhi la sems rtse gcig ba ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang chos kyi dbyings te tshad ma bzhi la sems rtse gcig ba ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The limb of enlightenment that is concentration is the one-pointedness of mind on the four authorities: reality, the reality limit, emptiness, and the reality-sphere.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa las nges par byung ba ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa las nges par byung ba ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The limb of enlightenment that is effort is the emergence from the stage of the common man.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib ba'i gnyen bo ma yin pa lus dang ngag dang sems kyi 'du byed la ltos pa med pa ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib ba'i gnyen bo ma yin pa lus dang ngag dang sems kyi 'du byed la ltos pa med pa ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: The limb of enlightenment that is equanimity is the absence of dependence on the motivating forces of body, speech, and mind, which are not the antidote to the obscuration of the passions.

original: sdig pa 'ba' zhig dang rjes su mthun pa'i nyon mongs ba'i sgrib ba'i gnyen por gyur ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do ;
analyzed: sdig pa 'ba' zhig dang rjes su mthun pa'i nyon mongs ba'i sgrib ba'i gnyen por gyur ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do ;
translated: The eightfold noble path is the noble path because it is the antidote to the obscuration of the passions, which is in conformity with the sole bad .

original: / shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i sgom pas tshol ba ni lam mo //
analyzed: / shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i sgom pas tshol ba ni lam mo //
translated: The path is the search by the cultivation which eliminates the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de'i phyir 'di 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad du bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad du bstan te /
translated: Therefore, it is taught as the eightfold noble path.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: Right view, right thought, right speech, right activity, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: and right concentration.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol la blta ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol la blta ba'o //
translated: Right view is the characteristic of the selflessness of all things and the view of the world beyond.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni blang pa dang dor ba dag spong ba dang / mngon du byed pa yid kyis byed pa dang / dge ba 'ba' zhig la sems pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni blang pa dang dor ba dag spong ba dang / mngon du byed pa yid kyis byed pa dang / dge ba 'ba' zhig la sems pa'o //
translated: Right thought is the mental activity of abandoning what is to be taken up and what is to be abandoned, and of manifesting and contemplating only the wholesome.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag ni bden pa mthong ba'i don ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag ni bden pa mthong ba'i don ston par byed do //
translated: Right speech is that which reveals the meaning of seeing the truth.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni /
translated: Right activity is

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las gang gong na med pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las gang gong na med pa'o //
translated: the activity of body, speech, and mind that is unsurpassed.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni rigs las skyes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni rigs las skyes pa'i don to //
translated: Right livelihood is the meaning of born from the family.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba @20b ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la rjes su sbyor ba lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba @20b ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la rjes su sbyor ba lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
translated: Right effort is the activity of body, speech, and mind that is applied to the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Right mindfulness is not forgetting the teachings as they have been understood.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa mngon du byed pa'i sems so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa mngon du byed pa'i sems so //
translated: Right concentration is the mind that actualizes the aspects of the object.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' cod pan ni ;
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' cod pan ni ;
translated: The crown of Vajrasattva

original: / rnam dag ye shes lnga nyid do //
analyzed: / rnam dag ye shes lnga nyid do //
translated: is the five pristine consciousnesses of pure wisdom.

original: dpa' bo'i rtsa ba'i sngags nyid ni //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i rtsa ba'i sngags nyid ni //
translated: The hero's root mantra🔽is fully imagined with the thread of Brahmā.

analyzed: tshangs ba'i srad bur rab tu brtag / rdo rje phag mo'i sngags kyis ni //
translated: The mantra of Vajravārāhī

analyzed: mgul gyi mgul rgyan mtshan ba'o //
translated: is the necklace ornament of the neck.

original: brgya phyed phreng bas brgyan ba'o //
analyzed: brgya phyed phreng bas brgyan ba'o //
translated: is adorned with a garland of fifty.

analyzed: yi ge bdun gyi gsang sngags ni ;
translated: The mantra of the seven syllables

analyzed: / rna ba'i rna cha mdzes pa yin //
translated: is the beautiful earring of the ear.
